sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react' import { Title, FormButton, FormInput, WheatherInfoItem } from './components' import './index.css' const App = () => { const [weatherData, setWeatherData] = useState({}) const [city, setCity] = useState('') const API_KEY = 'f5c340f67db5b02bb40d79f20a1bc03e' const API = 'https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather?' const fetchWeather = (event) => { event.preventDefault() fetch(`${API}appid=${API_KEY}&q=${city}`) .then(res => res.json()) .then((data) => setWeatherData(data)) .catch((err) => console.error(err)) } const searchInputHandler = (event) => { setCity(event.target.value) } return (
<form className='form' onSubmit={fetchWeather}> <div className='searchBox'> <FormInput onChange={searchInputHandler} placeholder="search city..." /> <FormButton /> </div> </form> <div className="container"> <WheatherInfoItem title='Coty' info={WheatherInfoItem}/> </div> </div> ) } export default App
